Dear FRANCISCO GONZALEZ:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F were
all staying at Bethany Christian Services shelter. Staff 1 sexually
harassed Youth A. Staff 1 showed an inappropriate picture of
another unidentified minor. Staff 1 confessed on August 5 that he
was attractive to Youth C. On 08/13/2023, Staff 1 stated he
received a text message from Youth C. In the text message,
Youth C appeared to be taking a selfie in his underwear. Youth A
denied Staff 1 ever harassed him or requested anything sexual
from them. Youth B was questioned about the sexual harassment
and explained Staff 1 intended to kiss him in April when he invited
him and youth to his apartment. When they were leaving the
apartment, Staff 1 kept behind Youth B, and intended to hug him
and kiss him on the lips. Youth B had to push Staff 1 away. He
told Staff 1 "estas loco?" (you are crazy). Three weeks later when
Staff 1 and a group of youth went to the movies, Staff 1 told Youth
A "te gustaria que te la ma??" which is believed to be an offer to
engage in oral sex. Youth B told Staff 1 to "leave me alone
because I will not be participating in those kinds of things. I am
going to report you." Staff 1 stopped and got upset. On one
occasion Staff 1 asked Youth B to go to pick up food. Staff 1
parked the car aside the road and started touching Youth B on his
legs. Youth B rejected Staff 1, causing Staff 1 to let him go and
start driving again. Youth B observed Staff 1 being very friendly
with some of the other youth at different times including Youth G.
On at least one occasion, Staff 1 said to child Youth G "te gustaria
que te la ma?" which is believed to be a slur to engage in oral sex.
Youth G told Staff 1 "no, no me gustan esas cosas" which means
no, I don't like those things. Staff 1 likes Youth F and Youth H and
has been too friendly with these youth. It is believed these events
happened on and around 8/5/2023.
2

Investigation Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23 and 8/21/23. She reported being aware of the allegations
and her primary role at the facility is the Assistant Director but was
previously the “Prevention Sexual Abuse Manager”. She reported
Therapist reported the allegations as Youth B disclosed to
Therapist. Therapist is both Youth A and Youth B’s therapist.
Administrator reported the facility is reviewing the GPS tracker on
the agency cars used to transport youth so they can determine if
and when youth were transported to Staff 1’s home and movies as
part of the allegations. She reported the new allegations involve
Youth G who left the program on 6/18/23. Youth A had informed
Therapist and Law Enforcement about Youth G.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23 and 8/21/23. She reported being made aware of the
allegations and a team of administrators at the facility are in the
process of completing the required reports for the oversite
governing agencies for the facility. She reported being the primary
therapist for Staff 1 when he was placed as a youth at the
program many years ago (began placement on 7/23/15). She was
unable to recall any significant issues about Staff 1 when he was a
youth in the program. She also reported the prior Program
Director (Administrator 4) hired Staff 1 (6/21/21) after he applied
for a staffing position at the facility.
Administrator 3/Complainant was interviewed face to face at
the facility on 8/16/23. He reported receiving the information from
a supervisor who Therapist told about the allegations. Once
hearing the information Staff 1 was placed on leave. Staff 1 was
traveling back from Chicago after dropping a youth at their
sponsor’s home prior to the agency knowing of the allegations.
Staff 1 returned on 8/15/23 and has had no contact with any of the
youth in the program. Administrator 3/Complainant did not list
Therapist as an alleged perpetrator but rather as a non-offending
adult and this was discussed since the original allegations
indicated Therapist as an alleged perpetrator. He had nothing
more to add to the allegations.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23 and 8/21/23. She reported first receiving the allegations
from Youth B during a therapy session. Youth B wanted to know
who the staff was that would be transporting him to his sponsor.
Youth B told her, he didn’t want Staff 1 to take him because he
doesn’t like Staff 1. Therapist questioned Youth B more and he
stated Staff 1 is “always saying sexual things to me”. Youth B also
told Therapist Staff 1 tells the other youth he is gay and likes boys.
3

Youth B told her another unidentified youth told him to be careful
with Staff 1 because Staff 1 showed him a picture of a youth in his
underwear that used to be in the program. Youth B was shown the
picture on a Sunday night. Youth B reported Staff 1 was always
hugging youth and was too friendly with the youth. Staff 1 once
touched Youth B’s leg and forced Youth B to kiss him. Another
incident occurred during an outing when Staff 1 asked a group of
unidentified youth if they wanted to see his apartment and they
said yes. This resulted in Staff 1 getting Youth B alone on his
terrace so the other unidentified youth involved in the outing
couldn’t see them and tried to hug and kiss Youth B. Staff 1
informed Youth B he likes other youth in the program. Youth B
reported to Therapist that he never said anything because he was
afraid but that he told Staff 1 if he doesn’t stop, he will make a
report. Therapist reported meeting with Youth A and Youth A
reported Staff 1 never touched him or did anything inappropriate
to him. Youth A reported Staff 1 showed him a picture of a former
youth in the program in his underwear that he received after this
specific youth left the program. Youth A thought this was wrong for
Staff 1 to have. Youth A overheard Staff 1 ask Youth B who he
likes and when Youth A asked Staff 1 who he likes, Staff 1
responded with Youth C. At the time Youth A didn’t think there
was anything wrong with Staff 1’s response. Therapist believes
the incident at Staff 1’s apartment must have taken place at least
3 months prior. She also reported generally there are more than
one staff present during outings. She reported during a follow-up
with Youth B, Youth B informed her Staff 1 told Youth B, he
offered oral sex to Youth G while he was in the program. Youth B
told Therapist Youth G informed him, Staff 1 offered Youth G
many other things but was unable to recall the specifics.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23. He reported working as a coworker with Staff 1 and now
working as a supervisor with Staff 1. He knows about the
allegations and never suspected any inappropriate behaviors from
Staff 1. He reported Staff 1 appeared to be a mentor to the youth
and had a good relationship with the youth. He reported many
outings only had one staff for six youth but understands the policy
is being changed. He believes they tried to have more than one
staff but because of staffing issues they did not always have the
extra staff. He reported having to speak to Staff 1 because
sometimes Staff 1 was not following a specific rule or policy such
as being on time.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23. He reported working as both a coworker and supervisor
4

with Staff 1. He reported Staff 1 had issues during his employment
such as showing up late and appearing to not take care of himself
mentally. There are “coaching notes” in his HR file about these
issues. He reported prior to being told about the allegations, he
had no concerns about Staff 1’s professional boundaries. The
small things he observed did not appear to be reg flags of sexual
behaviors but red flags of a professional behavior. He reported the
outing policy was one staff to six youth but understands that has
been changed to always have two staff.
Interviews were attempted with Youth A and Youth B, but
both declined to be interviewed on 8/21/23 at the facility.
MDHHS worker reported she has findings in their
investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. There is no
documentation of any disciplinary action taken with Staff 1 in his
personnel file. Documentation in the form of a letter dated 8/15/23
indicates he is being placed on paid administrative leave pending
the current investigation. Another document dated 5/28/21
indicates Staff 1 was cleared to work at the facility. Documentation
of Staff 1’s “2022 Annual Performance Review” covering the
period of 1/1/2022 to 12/31/22 stated Staff 1 was graded as 3.1
out of possible 5.0 for his complete evaluation. His area for
improvement is “completion of all required trainings in a timely
manner”. Documentation of Staff 1’s “2021 Annual Performance
Review” covering the period of 1/1/21 to 12/31/21 stated Staff 1
was graded as 4.0 out of possible 5.0 for his complete evaluation.
Training records document Staff 1 indicated he was registered for
the “Maintaining Professional Boundaries” training (on-line) on
8/3/23, but there is no record of him completing this training.
CAC interview of Youth B notes on 8/21/23 authored by
MDHHS worker who was present. Youth B reported he was very
concerned about which staff would be transporting him to his new
placement. When questioned on this, Youth B reported Staff 1
was his concern because Staff 1 would say sexual things to him.
Staff 1 told him he likes Youth A and boys. Youth B reported he
was at Staff 1’s apartment when Staff 1 hugged and kissed him.
Youth B reported pushing Staff 1 away from him at the time. Also,
during this incident at Staff 1’s apartment, Staff 1 offered to buy
the other youth present a coke if they didn’t tell what was going
on. Staff 1 came out of the bathroom and hugged Youth B before
5

grabbing him and rubbing his bottom. Staff 1 then began to rub his
penis over Youth B’s clothes. During the incident that occurred at
the movies, Staff 1 offered Youth B oral sex and Youth B told him
Staff 1 was crazy and to leave him alone. Youth B also reported
another incident in which he was riding in the car with Staff 1 and
Staff 1 stopped the car and began touching Youth B’s leg and
asked to have sex with him. After telling Staff 1 he was going to
report him, Staff 1 became angry and stopped talking to Youth B.
Staff 1 also showed Youth B a naked picture of Youth C. Youth B
reported Staff 1 was always touching him (face and legs) and
would try to kiss him multiple times. Staff 1 was reported to have
asked Youth B to meet after the left the program so they could
have sex and asked for his phone number. Youth B reported Staff
1 had acted the same way to Youth G.
Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County report for Youth
B dated 8/17/2023. Youth B reported to the interviewer of
witnessing Staff 1 hold hands and hug another unidentified youth
when they were on an outing at the zoo. He also reported Youth G
(no longer at the facility) had told him Staff 1 asked to have oral
sex with Youth G when they were at a store on an outing after
asking Youth G to have a sexual relationship with Staff 1. Youth B
reported being informed by Youth A, Staff 1 showed Youth A
pictures of Youth C unclothed and then Staff 1 showed Youth A
messages of Staff 1 asking for more pictures of Youth C. Youth B
also reported, Staff 1 has the phone numbers of numerous youth
who have left the program and has groups of youth who were in
the program on the “WhatsApp”. Youth B reported Staff 1 first
approached Youth B as a friend and then began to touch Youth B
before asking Youth B for his phone number so Staff 1 could
contact Youth B after Youth B left the program. Staff 1 informed
Youth B, Staff 1 wanted Youth B’s phone number so they could
meet up and have sex. Staff 1 told Youth B if they didn’t want to
have sex they could just meet up. Youth B described one incident
with Staff 1. Staff 1 asked Youth B to go to get a pizza and Youth
B went, believing other youth or staff would also be going. Youth B
was surprised only Staff 1 and himself were going. Staff 1 parked
the car away from the road and any others. Staff 1 asked Youth B
if he wanted to have oral sex and began to hold Youth B’s hand
and rub his leg in his genital area. Staff 1 grabbed Youth B’s face
and pulled Youth B close attempting to kiss Youth B. Youth B
pushed Staff 1 away and told him he wanted nothing to do with
him. Staff 1 said he wanted to kiss Youth B and touch him all over
his body and tried to kiss Youth B again. Youth B became very
upset and told Staff 1 he was going to report him. Staff 1
responded by telling Youth B not to say anything because Staff 1
6

could lose his job. Youth B described a second incident with Staff
1 that occurred when they were on an outing with three other
youth, Staff 1, and Youth B. They were downtown and needed to
use the restroom when Staff 1 told them they could come to his
apartment to use the restroom. Once at Staff 1’s apartment, Youth
B was going to use the restroom when Staff 1 grabbed his genital
area and butt while trying to kiss him. This occurred when the
other youth were in the living room listening to music. Youth B told
Staff 1 he would scream and call the other youth to which Staff 1
became upset and stopped. The third incident between Youth B
and Staff 1 involved another outing when they went to the movies.
Staff 1 was reported by Youth B to ask for oral sex with Youth B.
Youth B reported to know that Staff 1 has access to other youth in
the program and will transport to their next placements. Because
of this, transporting youth was coming up for Youth B, he decided
to report Staff 1’s behaviors because he feared Staff 1 would have
a chance to engage in these behaviors with him again. Youth B
denied anyone told him what to say or not say during this
interview.
Children’s Advocacy Center of Kent County report for Youth
A dated 8/17/2023. Youth A reported being in an outing in
downtown Grand Rapids at a festival with Staff 1 and several
other (unidentified) youth. At some point, Youth A was next to
Staff 1 and a few feet away from the other youth, when Staff 1 told
him, Staff 1 liked Youth C as a boyfriend. Youth A also reported a
few days later Staff 1 showed him pictures on his cell phone of
Youth C. The first picture was of Youth C with pants on and the
second picture was of Youth C in just his underwear. Staff 1 is
reported to have told Youth A, Youth C just sent the pictures to
Staff 1 but since then, Staff 1 has requested more pictures. Staff 1
was using the “Whatsapp” to communicate with Youth C. Youth A
reported Youth B told him about Staff 1 flirting and touching him
and Youth A denied this ever occurred to him.
Federal Bureau of Investigation interview of Youth I dated
9/20/23. Youth I reported Youth B was in a relationship with Staff
1 and Youth B was in love with Staff 1. Youth B went to Staff 1’s
apartment with him but Youth I was not aware of what took place
there. Youth I reported upon Youth B and Staff 1’s return, Youth B
said he wanted nothing to do with Staff 1 and would report Staff 1
when he was removed from the facility.
Bethany Christian Services Staff code of Conduct 4.3.5 dated
6/23/2023. This document outlines the behaviors that “must not”
be engaged in by staff, contractors, and volunteers. The first one
7

listed is sexual abuse, sexual harassment, and inappropriate
sexual behavior, along with several other behaviors. The second
paragraph identifies sexual contact as prohibited. Paragraph 6
indicates staff are not to have contact following the youth’s
discharge from the program. Paragraph 8 outlines that staff are
not to engage in any relationship with youth including romantic or
sexual while the youth is in the program and until the youth
reaches the age of 21 years old following discharge. According to
paragraph 9, staff are to report any knowledge, suspicion, or
information about inappropriate sexual behavior. Paragraph 14
indicates staff are to self-disclose their own misconduct that
occurs on or off duty. Additionally, it is stated, staff are not to
engage in exchanging pictures or personal phone numbers etc.,
with youth or their families.
Bethany Christian Services Unaccompanied Children’s
Programs Procedure for Supervising Clients Offsite dated
6/14/2021. This document indicates staff are to review this
procedure prior to any outings. Youth are to be in line of site at all
times during the outing with the exception of youth using the
restroom or meeting with their legal service provider. If these
exceptions occur, staff are to be in a reasonable vicinity. Staffing
ratio during an outing is identified as one staff for eight youth. Staff
are to conduct random intervals checks on youth throughout the
outing. These checks are to be documented and reviewed by
program leadership.
It is noted law enforcement continues to investigate these
allegations. Should law enforcement notify DCWL of the outcome
that results in further citations, an amendment to this report will be
completed.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation, evidence
supports that Staff 1 engaged inappropriate conversations and
inappropriate sexual touch resulting in being substantiated by the
MDHHS worker.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
8

Allegation Staff 1 failed to follow facility policies and the facility failed to
follow other policies of supervision.
Investigation Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23. Therapist reported believing the incident at Staff 1’s
apartment must have taken place at least 3 months prior. She also
reported generally there are more than one staff present during
outings.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23. He also reported many of the outing only had one staff for
six youth but understands the policy is being changed. He
believes they tried to have more than one staff but because of
staffing issues they did not always have the extra staff.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/16/23. He reported the outing policy was one staff to six staff but
understands that has been changed to two staff always.
Bethany Christian Services Unaccompanied Children’s
Programs Procedure for Supervising Clients Offsite dated
6/14/2021. This document indicates staff are to review this
procedure prior to any outings. Youth are to be in line of site at all
times during the outing with the exception of youth using the
restroom or meeting with their legal service provider. If these
exceptions occur, staff are to be in a reasonable vicinity. Staffing
ratio during an outing is identified as one staff for eight youth. Staff
are to conduct random intervals checks on youth throughout the
outing. These checks are to be documented and reviewed by
program leadership.
Email from Administrator 2 dated 9/1/2023. This email
confirmed that unannounced rounds for outings were not being
completed during the time frame and Administrator 2 raised this
concern to Bethany leadership.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance of their Procedure for
Supervising Clients Offsite as staff didn’t conduct random and
interval checks on youth during outings and document the checks.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2022C0128023 dated 2/11/22; CAP approved 3/4/22.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
